oai_dc:dc.dcterms:title: Adding molten glass to neck of carboy to make rim
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:creator: Creator, John
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:rights: This is a textual rights statement
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:description: View of a worker adding molten glass to the neck of a carboy, a type of vessel used for the transportation and fermentation of liquids, at a Glass Works factory in New Jersey. This photograph is one of a set of six stereographs detailing the production of 12-gallon glass carboys.
oai_dc:dc.dcterms:relation: Here's a link to the collection finding aid.
